questiontext.text: A teacher is interested in the association between the number of hours that his students have studied (X) and their examination marks (Y). He performs a regression analysis with these two variables. The standardized regression coefficient (“beta” in SPSS) of the number of study hours can be interpreted as …

generalfeedback.text:
The correct answer is: the number of standard deviations that the number increases / decreases when the number of study hours increases by one standard deviation.

If you want to know more about regression models watch this clip.

Levels of Difficulty
Difficult

Bivariate linear regression

M&T Multivariate linear regression
Default value

answer.text: The standard deviation of the number of study hours.
The average increase/decrease of the grade if the student studies one extra hour.
The number of standard deviations that the number increases/decreases when the number of study hours increases by one standard deviation.
